thread.title: Canary Wharf skyscraper climbed by daring pranksters who touch top of building in astonishing stunt
thread.title_full: Canary Wharf skyscraper climbed by daring pranksters who touch top of building in astonishing stunt

author: Helena Horton
title: Canary Wharf skyscraper climbed by daring pranksters who touch top of building in astonishing stunt
text:
T wo so-called 'rooftoppers' have posted heart-stopping footage of their perilous climb to the top of One Canada Square, one of Canary Wharf's iconic buildings.
They posted an astonishing 10-and-a-half minute clip to YouTube, in which they manage to reach the top of London's second-tallest building.
The Canary Wharf Group, which owns the building, has said it is "working with the Metropolitan Police" after the security breach, and that it has tightened security provisions.
At the beginning of the clip, the camera man describes the climb as "almost impossible".
He said: “We are going to try to infiltrate the building called One Canada Square”.
I n the video, the two men jump over the security barriers, set off the alarm, get the lift to the top and then climb out of the building at a terrifying height.
They even film themselves touching the pyramid at the top of the skyscraper.
The pranksters were shocked to find out the doors to the roof on the 50th floor were unlocked.
Looking at London below, the camera man said: "Guys I can’t believe we are on here, it is crazy.
Watch | Crazy Daredevil Takes the Ultimate Risk to Film Extraordinary Video 02:23 “Should we touch the top? I need to touch the top of the building. I have done it. I have touched the top of Canary Wharf.
“My heart is pounding. We can literally see the whole of London, just everything.”
T he men have urged others not to try and copy them, saying the building is now locked off.
The video was uploaded by a YouTube user called Night Scape on Monday night.
A Canary Wharf Group spokesperson said: “We are actively investigating unauthorised entry into One Canada Square, on the Canary Wharf Estate.
"Security is taken extremely seriously at Canary Wharf. We invest heavily in our security and review the processes on a regular basis.
"Current arrangements have been tightened, while our security procedures are being reviewed and an internal investigation conducted.
"We are working closely with the Metropolitan Police on this matter. Our priority is to ensure the safety of our tenants, employees and those visiting the Estate.”
Watch | Daredevils climb London skyscraper during New Year's Eve fireworks 01:05
